code: sparse_matrix <- simulate_sparse_matrix(   2000,   2000,   density = 0.01 )  system.time(as.matrix(sparse_matrix)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.001   0.003   0.005  system.time(as_matrix(sparse_matrix)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.001   0.003   0.005  system.time(as_matrix(sparse_matrix, parallel = TRUE)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.001   0.003   0.004   identical(   as.matrix(sparse_matrix),   as_matrix(sparse_matrix) ) #> [1] TRUE  identical(   as.matrix(sparse_matrix),   as_matrix(sparse_matrix, parallel = TRUE) ) #> [1] TRUE  identical(   sparse_matrix,   as_matrix(as.matrix(sparse_matrix), sparse = TRUE) ) #> [1] TRUE  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ network_table_0 <- inferCSN(example_matrix)  network_table_1 <- inferCSN(   as_matrix(example_matrix, sparse = TRUE) ) network_table_2 <- inferCSN(   as(example_matrix, "sparseMatrix") )  plot_scatter(   data.frame(     network_table_0$weight,     network_table_1$weight   ),   legend_position = "none" )  plot_scatter(   data.frame(     network_table_1$weight,     network_table_2$weight   ),   legend_position = "none" ) } # }

what: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: Calculates comprehensive performance metrics evaluating predicted network structures, including classification performance, precision-recall metrics, network topology metrics.

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
code: calculate_metrics(   network_table,   ground_truth,   metric_type = c("all", "auc", "auroc", "auprc", "precision", "recall", "f1",     "accuracy", "si", "ji"),   return_plot = FALSE,   line_color = "#1563cc",   line_width = 1 )

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: network_table data frame predicted network structure containing: regulator - Source nodes network edges target - Target nodes network edges weight - Edge weights representing prediction confidence ground_truth data frame ground truth network format network_table. metric_type type metric return, default . can take following choices: - Returns available metrics Performance Metrics plot auc - Returns AUROC AUPRC plots auroc - Area ROC Curve plot auprc - Area Precision-Recall Curve plot precision - Proportion correct predictions among positive predictions recall - Proportion actual positives correctly identified f1 - Harmonic mean precision recall accuracy - Overall classification accuracy si - Set Intersection, counting correctly predicted edges ji - Jaccard Index, measuring overlap predicted true networks return_plot Logical value, default FALSE, whether generate visualization plots line_color Color plot lines, default #1563cc line_width Width plot lines, default 1

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
text: list containing: metrics - data frame requested metrics plot - plot object return_plot = TRUE (optional)

title: Calculate Network Prediction Performance Metrics — calculate_metrics
code: data("example_matrix") data("example_ground_truth") network_table <- inferCSN(example_matrix) #> ℹ [2025-05-07 09:38:33] Running for <dense matrix>. #> ℹ [2025-05-07 09:38:33] Checking input parameters. #> ℹ [2025-05-07 09:38:33] Using L0 sparse regression model. #> ℹ [2025-05-07 09:38:33] Using 1 core #> ✔ [2025-05-07 09:38:33] Run done. calculate_metrics(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   return_plot = TRUE ) #> $metrics #>      Metric  Value #> 1     AUROC  0.952 #> 2     AUPRC  0.437 #> 3 Precision  0.529 #> 4    Recall  1.000 #> 5        F1  0.692 #> 6       ACC  0.948 #> 7        JI  0.514 #> 8        SI 18.000 #>  #> $plot  #>  calculate_metrics(   network_table,   example_ground_truth,   metric_type = "auroc" ) #> $metrics #>   Metric Value #> 1  AUROC 0.952 #>

code: inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'matrix' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'sparseMatrix' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'data.frame' inferCSN(   object,   penalty = "L0",   cross_validation = FALSE,   seed = 1,   n_folds = 5,   subsampling_method = c("sample", "meta_cells", "pseudobulk"),   subsampling_ratio = 1,   r_squared_threshold = 0,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   cores = 1,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: inferring cell-type specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
text: object input data inferCSN. penalty type regularization, default L0. can take either one following choices: L0, L0L1, L0L2. high-dimensional sparse data, L0L2 effective. cross_validation Logical value, default FALSE, whether use cross-validation. seed random seed cross-validation, default 1. n_folds number folds cross-validation, default 5. subsampling_method method use subsampling. Options "sample", "pseudobulk" "meta_cells". subsampling_ratio percent samples used fit_srm, default 1. r_squared_threshold Threshold \(R^2\) coefficient, default 0. regulators regulator genes infer regulatory network. targets target genes infer regulatory network. Recommend setting small fraction min(n,p) (e.g. 0.05 * min(n,p)) L0 regularization typically selects small portion non-zeros. cores number cores use parallelization foreach, default 1. verbose Logical value, default TRUE, whether print progress messages. ... Parameters methods.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
text: function detects metacells single-cell gene expression matrix using dimensionality reduction clustering techniques.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
code: meta_cells(   matrix,   genes_use = NULL,   genes_exclude = NULL,   var_genes_num = min(1000, nrow(matrix)),   gamma = 10,   knn_k = 5,   do_scale = TRUE,   pc_num = 25,   fast_pca = FALSE,   do_approx = FALSE,   approx_num = 20000,   directed = FALSE,   use_nn2 = TRUE,   seed = 1,   cluster_method = "walktrap",   block_size = 10000,   weights = NULL,   do_median_norm = FALSE,   ... )

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells
text: matrix gene expression matrix rows represent genes columns represent cells. genes_use Default NULL. character vector specifying genes used PCA dimensionality reduction. genes_exclude Default NULL. character vector specifying genes excluded PCA computation. var_genes_num Default min(1000, nrow(matrix)). Number variable genes select genes_use provided. gamma Default 10. Coarse-graining parameter defining target ratio input cells output metacells (e.g., gamma=10 yields approximately n/10 metacells n input cells). knn_k Default 5. Number nearest neighbors constructing cell-cell similarity network. do_scale Default TRUE. Whether standardize (center scale) gene expression values PCA. pc_num Default 25. Number principal components retain downstream analysis. fast_pca Default TRUE. Whether use faster irlba algorithm instead standard PCA. Recommended large datasets. do_approx Default FALSE. Whether use approximate nearest neighbor search datasets >50000 cells improve computational efficiency. approx_num Default 20000. Number cells randomly sample approximate nearest neighbor computation do_approx = TRUE. directed Default FALSE. Whether construct directed undirected nearest neighbor graph. use_nn2 Default TRUE. Whether use faster RANN::nn2 algorithm nearest neighbor search (applicable Euclidean distance). seed Default 1. Random seed reproducibility subsampling cells approximate mode. cluster_method Default walktrap. Algorithm community detection cell similarity network. Options: walktrap (recommended) louvain (gamma parameter ignored). block_size Default 10000. Number cells process batch mapping cells metacells approximate mode. Adjust based available memory. weights Default NULL. Numeric vector cell-specific weights weighted averaging computing metacell expression profiles. Length must match number cells. do_median_norm Default FALSE. Whether perform median-based normalization final metacell expression matrix. ... Additional arguments passed internal functions.

title: Detection of metacells from single-cell gene expression matrix — meta_cells

title: Fit a sparse regression model — sparse_regression
text: x matrix regulators. y vector target. penalty type regularization, default L0. can take either one following choices: L0, L0L1, L0L2. high-dimensional sparse data, L0L2 effective. algorithm type algorithm used minimize objective function, default CD. Currently CD CDPSI supported. CDPSI algorithm may yield better results, also increases running time. regulators_num number non-zore coefficients, value affect final performance. maximum support size terminate regularization path. cross_validation Logical value, default FALSE, whether use cross-validation. n_folds number folds cross-validation, default 5. seed random seed cross-validation, default 1. loss loss function. nLambda number Lambda values select. nGamma number Gamma values select. gammaMax maximum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty automatically selected. gammaMin minimum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. L0L1 penalty, minimum value gamma grid set gammaMin * gammaMax. Note strictly positive quantity. partialSort TRUE, partial sorting used sorting coordinates greedy cycling. Otherwise, full sorting used. maxIters maximum number iterations (full cycles) CD per grid point. rtol relative tolerance decides terminate optimization, based relative change objective iterations. atol absolute tolerance decides terminate optimization, based absolute L2 norm residuals. activeSet TRUE, performs active set updates. activeSetNum number consecutive times support appear declaring support stabilization. maxSwaps maximum number swaps used CDPSI grid point. scaleDownFactor parameter decides close selected Lambda values . screenSize number coordinates cycle performing initial correlation screening. autoLambda Ignored parameter. Kept backwards compatibility. lambdaGrid grid Lambda values use computing regularization path. excludeFirstK parameter takes non-negative integers. intercept FALSE, intercept term included model. lows Lower bounds coefficients. highs Upper bounds coefficients. verbose Logical value, default TRUE, whether print progress messages. ... Parameters methods.
